name: py-click
description: Python composable command line interface toolkit.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependent_to.name: py-mercantile
dependent_to.description: Web mercator XYZ tile utilities.

dependent_to.name: py-py2neo
dependent_to.description:
Py2neo is a client library and toolkit for working with Neo4j from
within Python applications and from the command line.

dependent_to.name: py-planet
dependent_to.description: Python client library and CLI for Planet's public API

dependent_to.name: py-sierrapy
dependent_to.description: A Client of HIVdb Sierra GraphQL Webservice

dependent_to.name: py-geocube
dependent_to.description: Tool to convert geopandas vector data into rasterized xarray data.

dependent_to.name: py-fava
dependent_to.description:
Fava is a web interface for the double-entry bookkeeping software
Beancount with a focus on features and usability.

dependent_to.name: py-distributed
dependent_to.description: Distributed scheduler for Dask

dependent_to.name: cget
dependent_to.description: Cmake package retrieval.

dependent_to.name: py-archspec
dependent_to.description:
A library for detecting, labeling and reasoning about
microarchitectures.

dependent_to.name: py-radiant-mlhub
dependent_to.description: A Python client for Radiant MLHub.

dependent_to.name: py-chalice
dependent_to.description: Python Serverless Microframework for AWS.

dependent_to.name: py-datacube
dependent_to.description: An analysis environment for satellite and other earth observation data.

dependent_to.name: py-click-plugins
dependent_to.description:
An extension module for py-click to register external CLI commands via
setuptools entry-points.

dependent_to.name: py-click-didyoumean
dependent_to.description: Enable git-like did-you-mean feature in click

dependent_to.name: py-black
dependent_to.description:
Black is the uncompromising Python code formatter. By using it, you
agree to cede control over minutiae of hand-formatting. In return, Black
gives you speed, determinism, and freedom from pycodestyle nagging about
formatting.

dependent_to.name: py-snuggs
dependent_to.description: Snuggs are s-expressions for Numpy

dependent_to.name: py-coilmq
dependent_to.description: Lightweight Python STOMP message broker.

dependent_to.name: py-celery
dependent_to.description: Celery - Distributed Task Queue.

dependent_to.name: py-flask
dependent_to.description: A simple framework for building complex web applications.

dependent_to.name: py-fiona
dependent_to.description: Fiona reads and writes spatial data files.

dependent_to.name: gatetools
dependent_to.description: Python tools for GATE, see https://github.com/OpenGATE/Gate

dependent_to.name: py-rasterio
dependent_to.description:
Rasterio reads and writes geospatial raster data. Geographic information
systems use GeoTIFF and other formats to organize and store gridded, or
raster, datasets. Rasterio reads and writes these formats and provides a
Python API based on N-D arrays.

dependent_to.name: py-click-repl
dependent_to.description: Subcommand REPL for click apps

dependent_to.name: py-usgs
dependent_to.description: Client library for interfacing with USGS datasets

dependent_to.name: py-biom-format
dependent_to.description:
The BIOM file format (canonically pronounced biome) is designed to be a
general-use format for representing biological sample by observation
contingency tables.

dependent_to.name: py-wandb
dependent_to.description: A tool for visualizing and tracking your machine learning experiments.

dependent_to.name: py-cyvcf2
dependent_to.description: fast vcf parsing with cython + htslib

dependent_to.name: py-pybids
dependent_to.description: bids: interface with datasets conforming to BIDS

dependent_to.name: py-nltk
dependent_to.description:
The Natural Language Toolkit (NLTK) is a Python package for natural
language processing.

dependent_to.name: py-nipype
dependent_to.description: Neuroimaging in Python: Pipelines and Interfaces.

dependent_to.name: py-cfgrib
dependent_to.description:
Python interface to map GRIB files to the NetCDF Common Data Model
following the CF Convention using ecCodes.

dependent_to.name: py-ray
dependent_to.description:
A system for parallel and distributed Python that unifies the ML
ecosystem.

dependent_to.name: py-rq
dependent_to.description:
RQ (Redis Queue) is a simple Python library for queueing jobs and
processing them in the background with workers.

dependent_to.name: py-cookiecutter
dependent_to.description:
A command-line utility that creates projects from cookiecutters (project
templates). E.g. Python package projects, jQuery plugin projects.

dependent_to.name: gnuradio
dependent_to.description:
GNU Radio is a free & open-source software development toolkit that
provides signal processing blocks to implement software radios. It can
be used with readily-available, low-cost external RF hardware to create
software-defined radios, or without hardware in a simulation-like
environment. It is widely used in hobbyist, academic, and commercial
environments to support both wireless communications research and real-
world radio systems.

dependent_to.name: py-sacremoses
dependent_to.description: LGPL MosesTokenizer in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-multiqc
dependent_to.description:
MultiQC is a tool to aggregate bioinformatics results across many
samples into a single report. It is written in Python and contains
modules for a large number of common bioinformatics tools.

dependent_to.name: py-cekit
dependent_to.description:
CEKit is a Container image creation tool. CEKit helps to build container
images from image definition files with strong focus on modularity and
code reuse.

dependent_to.name: py-cligj
dependent_to.description:
Click-based argument and option decorators for Python GIS command line
programs
